cards.title: Packaging Policy Review
cards.prompt: Your packaging generates significant waste. What's your approach?

options.label: Switch to 100% compostable packaging
options.description: Higher upfront cost but eliminates plastic waste
options.explanation: Compostable packaging reduces landfill waste significantly but requires supplier changes and cost increases.

options.label: Implement reusable container program
options.explanation: Reusable containers eliminate single-use waste but require logistics setup and customer buy-in.

options.label: Minimal packaging redesign
options.description: Reduce packaging by 30%, keep existing materials
options.explanation: Reducing packaging is cost-effective but provides moderate environmental impact.

cards.title: Portion Size Adjustment
cards.prompt: Food waste from oversized portions is increasing. How do you respond?

options.label: Reduce all portions by 20%
options.explanation: Smaller portions reduce waste and costs but may disappoint customers initially.

options.label: Offer multiple portion sizes
options.explanation: Choice empowers customers but adds operational complexity.

cards.title: Supplier Evaluation: Local vs Bulk
cards.prompt: Your current bulk supplier offers lower prices but higher emissions. A local farm co-op is available.

options.label: Switch to local farm co-op
options.explanation: Local sourcing dramatically cuts transport emissions and builds community ties but increases costs.

options.label: Hybrid approach: 50% local, 50% bulk
options.explanation: Splitting suppliers moderates both cost impact and emission reductions.

options.label: Negotiate greener shipping with bulk supplier
options.explanation: Incremental improvements without major changes to supply chain.

cards.title: Comprehensive Food Waste Audit
cards.prompt: You need data to understand waste patterns. How deep should the audit go?

options.label: Full 30-day audit with third-party consultant
options.description: Detailed tracking of all waste streams
options.explanation: Professional audit provides actionable insights but requires investment.

options.label: Internal staff tracking for 2 weeks
options.description: Train existing staff to log waste
options.explanation: Lower-cost approach with moderate data quality.

cards.title: Composting Program Launch
cards.prompt: Organic waste represents 40% of your total waste. Consider composting infrastructure.

options.label: Install on-site composting system
options.explanation: On-site composting eliminates organic waste transport and creates usable compost.

options.label: Partner with commercial composting service
options.explanation: Commercial service handles logistics but adds recurring fees.

options.label: Small pilot with select waste streams
options.description: Test composting with coffee grounds only
options.explanation: Low-risk pilot builds knowledge before full commitment.

cards.title: Community Sustainability Outreach
cards.prompt: Trust is declining. How do you communicate your sustainability efforts?

options.label: Launch public sustainability dashboard
options.explanation: Transparency builds trust by making impact measurable and visible.

options.label: Publish quarterly sustainability reports
options.explanation: Regular reporting shows commitment without real-time overhead.

options.label: Social media campaign highlighting wins
options.explanation: Low-cost awareness building but may appear performative.

cards.title: Energy-Efficient Equipment Investment
cards.prompt: Your kitchen equipment is outdated and inefficient. Consider upgrades.

options.label: Replace all major equipment with Energy Star models
options.explanation: New equipment dramatically reduces energy use but requires significant capital.

options.label: Phase replacement over 18 months
options.explanation: Gradual approach spreads costs while delivering improvements.

options.label: Optimize existing equipment with better maintenance
options.explanation: Low-cost efficiency gains without capital expenditure.

cards.title: Menu Redesign for Lower Footprint
cards.prompt: Your menu features many high-emission items. Consider a sustainability-focused redesign.

options.label: Shift to 70% plant-based menu
options.explanation: Plant-based meals dramatically reduce emissions and often cost less.

options.label: Keep menu, source sustainably-raised meat/dairy
options.description: Higher quality, higher cost animal products
options.explanation: Ethical sourcing improves footprint without changing offerings.

options.label: Seasonal menu rotation with local ingredients
options.explanation: Seasonal approach optimizes for what's available locally.

cards.title: Community Backlash on Price Increases
cards.prompt: Customers are complaining about higher prices from sustainability initiatives. How do you respond?

options.label: Publish detailed cost breakdown showing why prices increased
options.description: Educate on true cost of sustainability
options.explanation: Transparency helps customers understand value of changes.

options.label: Launch sliding-scale discount for low-income customers
options.description: Absorb cost for those who need it
options.explanation: Equity-focused approach maintains access despite price increases.

options.label: Temporarily roll back least popular changes
options.explanation: Pragmatic retreat to rebuild support before expanding again.

cards.title: Unexpected Budget Constraints
cards.prompt: Funding has been cut by 15%. What sustainability initiatives are protected?

options.label: Maintain waste reduction programs, cut emissions initiatives
options.explanation: Focus on tangible waste outcomes customers can see.

options.label: Maintain emissions programs, reduce waste spending
options.explanation: Climate-first approach even if less visible to customers.

options.label: Cut everything except efficiency improvements
options.description: Efficiency pays for itself over time
options.explanation: Invest only in changes that reduce ongoing costs.

cards.title: Water Conservation Initiative
cards.prompt: Water usage is higher than industry benchmarks. What's your strategy?

options.label: Install low-flow fixtures and sensors
options.explanation: Infrastructure upgrade reduces water and energy for heating.

options.label: Implement water-saving operational procedures
options.explanation: Behavioral changes with minimal cost but requiring ongoing enforcement.

cards.title: Renewable Energy Transition
cards.prompt: Your energy is 100% grid-sourced fossil fuels. Consider renewable options.

options.label: Install rooftop solar panels
options.explanation: Solar dramatically cuts emissions but requires major capital investment.

options.label: Switch to utility renewable energy plan
options.explanation: Immediate emission reduction with ongoing cost increase.

options.label: Join community solar cooperative
options.description: Share in local solar farm output
options.explanation: Collective approach reduces individual cost burden.

cards.title: Sustainability Training Program
cards.prompt: Staff lack knowledge to support sustainability goals. How comprehensive should training be?

options.label: Full-day workshop for all staff quarterly
options.explanation: Deep training builds culture but requires time and money.

options.label: Add sustainability module to onboarding
options.explanation: Baseline knowledge for all staff with minimal disruption.

cards.title: Delivery & Takeout Sustainability
cards.prompt: Delivery orders are growing. Single-use containers are a major waste source.

options.label: Implement reusable container delivery service
options.description: Customers return containers on next order
options.explanation: Eliminates single-use waste but adds logistics complexity.

options.label: Switch to certified compostable takeout containers
options.explanation: Reduces landfill impact if customers have composting access.

options.label: Discount for customers who bring their own containers
options.explanation: Customer-driven solution with minimal operational change.

cards.title: Surplus Food Donation Program
cards.prompt: You have consistent surplus food at end of day. What's your approach?

options.label: Daily donation partnership with local shelter
options.explanation: Redirects food from waste while serving community need.

options.label: List surplus on food rescue app
options.explanation: Flexible approach but less reliable than partnership.

cards.title: Carbon Offset Program Evaluation
cards.prompt: You can't eliminate all emissions. Consider purchasing carbon offsets.

options.label: Purchase verified carbon offsets for all operations
options.explanation: Offsets compensate for unavoidable emissions but add costs.

options.label: Fund local reforestation project directly
options.explanation: Visible local impact builds community connection.

options.label: Skip offsets, invest in direct emission reductions
options.explanation: Prioritize eliminating emissions over compensating for them.

cards.title: Sustainability Certification Program
cards.prompt: Third-party certifications can validate your efforts. Which do you pursue?

options.label: Pursue B Corporation certification
options.explanation: Rigorous certification signals serious commitment.

options.label: Green Restaurant Association certification
options.explanation: Targeted certification for food service operations.

options.label: Create own sustainability badge and criteria
options.explanation: Lower cost but less credibility without third-party validation.

cards.title: Supply Chain Sustainability Audit
cards.prompt: Your suppliers' practices affect your overall footprint. How deep do you audit?

options.label: Full lifecycle assessment of top 20 suppliers
options.explanation: Comprehensive data enables targeted supplier changes.

options.label: Send sustainability questionnaire to all suppliers
options.explanation: Lightweight approach gathers baseline information.

options.label: Audit only Tier 1 suppliers (direct relationships)
options.explanation: Manageable scope while addressing major impact sources.

cards.title: Sustainability Innovation Fund
cards.prompt: Set aside budget for experimental sustainability projects. How much?

options.label: Allocate 5% of revenue to innovation fund
options.explanation: Large fund enables ambitious experimental projects.

options.label: Allocate 2% of revenue to innovation fund
options.explanation: Modest investment allows controlled experimentation.

cards.title: Stakeholder Engagement Strategy
cards.prompt: Multiple groups want input on sustainability direction. How do you engage?

options.label: Form sustainability advisory council
options.explanation: Formal structure gives stakeholders voice in decisions.

options.label: Bi-annual town hall meetings
options.explanation: Public forums build transparency without ongoing commitment.

options.label: Online surveys and suggestion box
options.explanation: Low-touch engagement gathers input without meetings.

cards.title: Staff Performance Incentives
cards.prompt: Tie staff bonuses to sustainability metrics to drive accountability?

options.label: Team bonuses based on monthly waste reduction
options.explanation: Team incentives foster collaboration around shared goals.

options.label: Individual bonuses for sustainability suggestions implemented
options.explanation: Individual rewards encourage creative problem-solving.

options.label: Keep sustainability part of job expectations, no bonuses
options.explanation: Avoids financializing sustainability but may reduce urgency.

cards.title: Expansion vs Consolidation
cards.prompt: You have an opportunity to expand operations. How does this affect sustainability?

options.label: Expand with sustainability-first facility design
options.description: New location built to green standards
options.explanation: Growth opportunity to implement best practices from start.

options.label: Consolidate to single efficient location
options.explanation: Smaller footprint with economies of scale.

options.label: Defer expansion, optimize current operations first
options.explanation: Prove sustainability at current scale before growing.

cards.title: Student Sustainability Partnership
cards.prompt: Students want to collaborate on sustainability initiatives. How involved should they be?

options.label: Hire student interns to lead sustainability projects
options.explanation: Student leadership brings fresh ideas and builds campus engagement.

options.label: Create volunteer program for interested students
options.explanation: Volunteer model provides access without major budget impact.

cards.title: AI-Powered Food Waste Tracking
cards.prompt: Smart scale technology can automatically track and categorize waste. Worth the investment?

options.label: Deploy AI waste tracking across all stations
options.description: Computer vision + smart scales at every waste point
options.explanation: Automated tracking provides granular data to optimize ordering and prep.

options.label: Pilot AI system at main production kitchen
options.description: Test at one location before full rollout
options.explanation: Lower-risk pilot proves value before major investment.

options.label: Stick with manual tracking and staff training
options.explanation: No tech investment but requires ongoing staff effort.

cards.title: Regional Food Cooperative Formation
cards.prompt: Partner with other institutions to form a local food purchasing cooperative.

options.label: Be a founding member and invest heavily
options.description: Leadership role, higher costs, maximum benefits
options.explanation: Cooperative leadership builds regional sustainable food system.

options.label: Join as standard member with modest investment
options.explanation: Access cooperative benefits with lower commitment.

options.label: Monitor cooperative's progress before joining
options.explanation: Risk-averse approach but miss early-mover advantages.

cards.title: Sustainability-Focused Employee Benefits
cards.prompt: Offer benefits that support employees' personal sustainability goals.

options.label: Bike commute stipend + local food discounts + education credits
options.explanation: Comprehensive benefits support employees' values and retention.

options.label: Transit pass subsidies only
options.explanation: Targeted benefit addresses major emissions source.

cards.title: Predictive Demand Forecasting System
cards.prompt: Use historical data and AI to predict daily demand and reduce overproduction.

options.label: Machine learning forecasting with weather/event data
options.explanation: Accurate forecasting prevents overproduction and waste.

options.label: Spreadsheet-based historical analysis
options.description: Manual trend analysis from past data
options.explanation: Low-tech approach provides basic optimization.

cards.title: Zero-Waste Campus Event Catering
cards.prompt: A major campus event wants zero-waste catering. Can you deliver?

options.label: Commit to certified zero-waste event
options.description: Reusable everything, composting station, waste audit
options.explanation: Showcase event demonstrates capabilities but requires massive effort.

options.label: Low-waste event with some compromises
options.description: Minimize waste but allow some single-use items
options.explanation: Practical approach balances impact with operational feasibility.

options.label: Decline event, not ready for zero-waste standard
options.description: Focus on improving baseline operations first
options.explanation: Honest assessment avoids overpromising but misses visibility opportunity.

cards.title: On-Campus Urban Farm Development
cards.prompt: Convert unused campus land into food production. How ambitious should this be?

options.label: 2-acre production farm with greenhouse
options.explanation: Major farm provides significant local sourcing and educational value.

options.label: Quarter-acre teaching garden
options.explanation: Garden prioritizes learning and community engagement.

options.label: Rooftop herb and microgreens garden
options.explanation: Manageable project adds fresh elements to menu.

cards.title: IoT-Enabled Refrigeration Monitoring
cards.prompt: Smart sensors can optimize refrigeration and prevent food spoilage. Invest in IoT?

options.label: Comprehensive IoT system with predictive maintenance
options.description: Temperature monitoring, alerts, and AI optimization
options.explanation: Smart system prevents spoilage and optimizes energy use.

options.label: Basic temperature sensors with manual alerts
options.explanation: Affordable monitoring improves oversight without full automation.

cards.title: Upcycled Ingredient Sourcing
cards.prompt: Use ingredients that would otherwise be wasted (imperfect produce, brewing byproducts).

options.label: Dedicate 25% of menu to upcycled ingredients
options.explanation: Upcycled ingredients reduce system-wide waste and costs.

options.label: Use upcycled ingredients when available and appropriate
options.explanation: Flexible approach takes advantage of opportunities.

cards.title: Regenerative Agriculture Commitment
cards.prompt: Source from farms practicing regenerative agriculture that improves soil health.

options.label: Require regenerative certification for all produce
options.explanation: Regenerative agriculture sequesters carbon and improves ecosystems.

options.label: Partner with farms transitioning to regenerative practices
options.explanation: Help farms transition while building long-term partnerships.

options.label: Start with regenerative sourcing for select high-volume items
options.explanation: Focused approach proves concept before full commitment.

cards.title: Living Wage Commitment
cards.prompt: Commit to paying all workers a living wage. Impact on sustainability?

options.label: Raise all wages to living wage immediately
options.explanation: Living wage reduces turnover and shows commitment to social sustainability.

options.label: Phase in living wage over 18 months
options.explanation: Slower path to same goal manages budget impact.

options.label: Raise wages above minimum but not to full living wage
options.explanation: Incremental improvement without major cost increase.

cards.title: Circular Economy Dishware Program
cards.prompt: Replace dishes with durable, infinitely recyclable materials. Worth the switch?

options.label: Switch to glass and stainless steel dishware
options.description: Fully circular materials with take-back program
options.explanation: Durable materials eliminate waste from broken dishware.

options.label: Upgrade to bamboo fiber composite dishware
options.explanation: Natural materials reduce environmental impact moderately.

cards.title: Food Rescue Technology Platform
cards.prompt: Develop app connecting surplus food with community members in real-time.

options.label: Build custom app with real-time inventory
options.explanation: Custom solution optimized for your specific operations.

options.label: Partner with existing food rescue platform
options.description: Use established service like Too Good To Go
options.explanation: Proven platform with existing user base.

options.label: Post surplus availability on social media
options.explanation: Free approach with limited reach and convenience.

cards.title: Community Compost Distribution
cards.prompt: Finished compost from your program could benefit community gardens. Share it?

options.label: Free compost distribution program for community
options.description: Pickup days and delivery to local gardens
options.explanation: Community benefit from your sustainability efforts.

options.label: Sell compost at nominal fee to cover handling
options.explanation: Self-sustaining program with broad community access.

cards.title: Seasonal Operations Schedule
cards.prompt: Reduce operations during low-demand periods to save energy and resources?

options.label: Close 2 of 3 dining halls during summer
options.description: Concentrate operations when demand is low
options.explanation: Seasonal consolidation maximizes efficiency during slow periods.

options.label: Reduce hours during breaks, keep all locations open
options.description: Maintain access with shorter service windows
options.explanation: Balanced approach maintains convenience while cutting waste.

options.label: Maintain consistent year-round operations
options.explanation: Consistency valued over seasonal optimization.

cards.title: Blockchain Food Traceability
cards.prompt: Use blockchain to provide transparent supply chain tracking. Novel but expensive.

options.label: Implement end-to-end blockchain traceability
options.description: Every ingredient tracked from farm to plate
options.explanation: Ultimate transparency but requires supplier coordination and investment.

options.label: QR code system linking to supplier information
options.explanation: Practical transparency solution without bleeding-edge tech.

options.label: Publish supplier profiles on website
options.explanation: Basic transparency with minimal investment.

cards.title: Campus Biodiversity Enhancement
cards.prompt: Replace ornamental landscaping with native pollinator gardens and food forests.

options.label: Create perennial food forest on campus
options.explanation: Food forest provides habitat, carbon sequestration, and ingredients.

options.label: Convert high-visibility areas to native pollinator gardens
options.explanation: Native plants require less maintenance and support biodiversity.

cards.title: Sustainability Benchmarking Network
cards.prompt: Join consortium of universities sharing sustainability metrics and best practices.

options.label: Join benchmarking consortium with data sharing
options.explanation: Peer comparison drives continuous improvement.

options.label: Create informal network with peer institutions
options.explanation: Collaborative learning without membership fees.

cards.title: Climate Resilience Planning
cards.prompt: Prepare for climate impacts on supply chain. How proactive should you be?

options.label: Develop comprehensive climate adaptation plan
options.explanation: Proactive planning reduces vulnerability to climate disruptions.

options.label: Diversify suppliers across climate zones
options.explanation: Multiple sourcing regions ensure continuity during climate events.

options.label: Respond to disruptions as they occur
options.explanation: Reactive approach saves planning costs but increases vulnerability.

cards.title: Food Systems Education Program
cards.prompt: Teach diners about sustainable food systems. How much educational content?

options.label: Weekly workshops and cooking classes
options.explanation: Education builds lasting behavior change and engagement.

options.label: Informational signage and menu labeling
options.description: Passive education at point of service
options.explanation: Low-touch education reaches all diners with minimal effort.

cards.title: Alternative Protein Integration
cards.prompt: Add plant-based meat alternatives and cultivated proteins to menu?

options.label: Replace 50% of meat options with alternatives
options.explanation: Alternative proteins offer familiar experience with lower emissions.

options.label: Add alternatives as featured options alongside traditional
options.explanation: Expanded choice lets customers opt in without forcing change.

options.label: Focus on whole-food plant proteins (beans, lentils, tofu)
options.explanation: Whole foods offer sustainability benefits at lower cost.

cards.title: Container Deposit Return System
cards.prompt: Implement deposit system to incentivize container returns. Worth the logistics?

options.label: Install automated return kiosks with deposit tracking
options.explanation: Automation makes deposit system convenient and effective.

options.label: Staff-managed deposit and return at service counters
options.explanation: Personal approach builds relationships but requires staff time.

cards.title: Battery Energy Storage System
cards.prompt: Store renewable energy for use during peak demand periods. Big investment, major impact.

options.label: Install large-scale battery storage system
options.explanation: Battery storage maximizes renewable energy use and grid independence.

options.label: Ice thermal energy storage for cooling
options.description: Make ice at night, use for cooling during day
options.explanation: Thermal storage shifts energy use to off-peak hours.

options.label: Join utility demand response program without storage
options.description: Reduce usage during peak periods for credits
options.explanation: Grid participation provides benefits without major investment.

cards.title: Cultural Food Heritage Program
cards.prompt: Celebrate diverse cultural foodways while prioritizing sustainability. How to balance?

options.label: Monthly cultural cuisine spotlights with sustainable sourcing
options.explanation: Cultural celebration builds inclusive community around sustainable food.

options.label: Create fusion dishes merging cultural traditions with local ingredients
options.explanation: Creative approach balances cultural respect with sustainability.

cards.title: Food Policy Advocacy Campaign
cards.prompt: Advocate for state/federal policies supporting sustainable food systems?

options.label: Lead institutional coalition for policy reform
options.explanation: Policy change creates systemic impact beyond individual actions.

options.label: Join existing food policy advocacy organizations
options.explanation: Coalition participation amplifies voice without leadership burden.

options.label: Focus on internal changes, avoid political advocacy
options.explanation: Neutral stance avoids controversy but limits systemic impact.

cards.title: On-Site Surplus Food Processing
cards.prompt: Turn surplus produce into preserves, pickles, and sauces to extend shelf life.

options.label: Build dedicated food preservation kitchen
options.explanation: Processing infrastructure eliminates waste while creating new menu items.

options.label: Seasonal preservation projects with existing equipment
options.description: Use slow periods for value-added production
options.explanation: Work within existing capacity for modest preservation.

cards.title: Radical Transparency Challenge
cards.prompt: Live-stream kitchen operations and publish all sustainability data in real-time?

options.label: Install cameras and real-time data dashboard open to public
options.explanation: Radical transparency builds unprecedented trust but exposes all issues.

options.label: Offer regular behind-the-scenes tours and Q&A sessions
options.explanation: Curated access shows operations while managing narrative.

options.label: Quarterly reports with aggregated data
options.explanation: Traditional approach balances transparency with operational control.

cards.title: Zero-Emission Delivery Fleet
cards.prompt: Switch delivery vehicles to electric bikes and EVs for zero-emission logistics.

options.label: Replace all delivery vehicles with electric fleet
options.description: EVs and e-bikes with charging infrastructure
options.explanation: Zero-emission delivery eliminates transport emissions from operations.

options.label: Use cargo e-bikes for campus deliveries
options.description: Bikes for short-range, EVs for long-range
options.explanation: E-bikes work well for campus distances at lower cost.

options.label: Convert existing fleet to renewable biodiesel
options.description: Use existing vehicles with cleaner fuel
options.explanation: Incremental improvement without fleet replacement.
